org.usfirst.frc1991.SwerveDrive.subsystems

Class SwerveModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem
      • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.PIDSubsystem
        • org.usfirst.frc1991.SwerveDrive.subsystems.SwerveModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.NamedSendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable

    public class SwerveModule
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.PIDSubsystem
    An implementation of PIDSubsystem that enables a motor to be driven on a PID loop with one not on the loop at the same time.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.Boolean setPointLocked
      Whether the setpoint has been locked or not.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Create a new SwerveModule using the name, encoder, steering motor, and driving motor specified.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void disable()
      Disables the subsystem by disabling the PID loop and the drive motor.

      This subsystem has no default command, so nothing is initialized.

    • Field Detail

      • setPointLocked

        public java.lang.Boolean setPointLocked
        Whether the setpoint has been locked or not.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SwerveModule

        public SwerveModule(java.lang.String moduleName,
            edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.AnalogInput encoder,
            edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SpeedController steer,
            edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.SpeedController drive)
        Create a new SwerveModule using the name, encoder, steering motor, and driving motor specified. P, I, D, and input range values will be adopted from RobotMap.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name that will be visible in the SmartDashboard.
        encoder - The encoder to use as PID input.
        steer - The speed controller to use as PID output.
        drive - The speed controller that should not be connected to the PID loop; used for driving the wheel.

    • Method Detail

      • initDefaultCommand

        public void initDefaultCommand()
        This subsystem has no default command, so nothing is initialized.
        Specified by:
        initDefaultCommand in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.Subsystem

      • disable

        public void disable()
        Disables the subsystem by disabling the PID loop and the drive motor.
        Overrides:
        disable in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.PIDSubsystem

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(double speed)
        Sets the speed of the driving motor controller.
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed to set the motor controller to; this should be between -1 and 1.

      • setSetpoint

        public void setSetpoint(double setpoint)
        Sets the setpoint of the steering speed controller.
        Overrides:
        setSetpoint in class edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.command.PIDSubsystem
        Parameters:
        setpoint - The setpoint to steer to. This must be between the min and max setpoints specified in RobotMap or a crash will most likely occur.

      • lockSetpoint

        public void lockSetpoint(double setpointToLock)
        Locks the setpoint to the value specified. Future calls to setSetpoint(double) will be ignored until unlockSetpoint() is called.
        Parameters:
        setpointToLock - The setpoint to lock the module to. This must be between the min and max setpoints specified in RobotMap or a crash will most likely occur.

      • unlockSetpoint

        public void unlockSetpoint()
        Unlocks setpoint. If the setpoint was not locked, nothing will occur.
